item.title: U.S. accuses Iran of sending ballistic missiles to Russia
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum, Siobhán O'Grady
item.description: Tehran has sent missiles to Russia, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said, escalating the conflict in Ukraine and exacerbating tensions with the West.

item.title: Israeli strike kills 19 in Gaza humanitarian area, health officials say
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Kelly Kasulis Cho, Hajar Harb, Jennifer Hassan, Hazem Balousha
item.description: Gazan authorities reported deaths after missiles struck Mawasi, a safe zone designated for displaced people. The IDF said it was targeting Hamas militants.

item.title: U.S. demands IDF change West Bank operations after American’s killing
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum, Loveday Morris
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s comments were the strongest yet from a U.S. official after the Israeli military said it was “highly likely” it “unintentionally” killed Aysenur Eygi.

item.title: Man accused of setting Olympic runner on fire also dies of burns, hospital says
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Katharine Houreld, Rael Ombuor
item.description: A hospital in Kenya said Dickson Ndiema, the ex-boyfriend of runner Rebecca Cheptegei, died of burns sustained during his alleged fire attack after the Paris Olympics.

item.title: Apple, Google must pay billions in back taxes and fines, E.U. court rules
item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis, Cat Zakrzewski
item.description: The European Court of Justice said Apple must repay about $14.35 billion after reaping illegal tax benefits in Ireland and backed a $2.65 billion antitrust fine on Google.

item.title: Dozens dead after Typhoon Yagi makes landfall in Vietnam
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands
item.description: Dozens of people were dead or missing after Typhoon Yagi struck, triggering heavy rains and landslides. A steel bridge collapsed as a result of the flooding.

item.title: Ukraine launches largest drone attack yet on Moscow, killing 1, Russia says
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: Russia’s Defense Ministry said at least 140 drones were launched against targets across the country but most were shot down, including 14 in Moscow itself.

item.title: Australia plans social media minimum age, citing mental health concerns
item.dc:creator: Michael E. Miller
item.description: The government is considering a minimum age of between 14 and 16 for using apps without parental permission, but some experts warn of harmful consequences.

item.title: As Trump looms, Ukraine turns to its evangelicals to woo the Republicans
item.dc:creator: David Stern
item.description: Ukraine has the largest evangelical community in Europe and its outreach to Republicans could prove crucial in securing additional American aid.

item.title: What is ecocide and could it become an international crime like genocide?
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: Vanuatu, Fiji and Samoa — island nations particularly vulnerable to climate change — asked the International Criminal Court to make the destruction of ecosystems a crime.

item.title: ‘Gentle, brave, silly’: American killed in West Bank remembered by loved ones
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: Aysenur Eygi, a 26-year-old Turkish American, was killed while protesting a Jewish settlement expansion in the West Bank. She graduated from the University of Washington in June.

item.title: Palestinians honor U.S. activist killed in West Bank at memorial procession
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Loveday Morris, Annabelle Timsit
item.description: Aysenur Eygi was killed at a protest in the West Bank. The closure of West Bank-Jordan land crossings has complicated efforts to repatriate her body to Turkey.

item.title: Princess Kate says she has finished cancer chemo treatment
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: Catherine, largely out of the public eye since Christmas, said she was “looking forward to being back at work and undertaking a few more public engagements in the coming months when I can.”

item.title: In Ukraine’s Poltava, soldier buries a father he thought safe from war
item.dc:creator: Lizzie Johnson, Kostiantyn Khudov
item.description: One of the deadliest single bombardments of the war left dozens of victims to be buried more than 100 miles from the front lines.

item.title: Videos from Sudan’s killing fields reveal ethnic hatred behind massacres
item.dc:creator: Katharine Houreld, Hafiz Haroun, Lucy Provan, Klaas van Dijken, Maud Jullien
item.description: Sudan’s Darfur region was the scene of a genocide two decades ago. Exclusive videos shared with The Post show the inflamed bigotry behind a new wave of killings.

item.title: Israeli snipers again face scrutiny after death of civilian
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Witnesses say the Israel Defense Forces fatally shot Aysenur Eygi, a 26-year-old American volunteer in the West Bank. The IDF said it was “looking into reports that a foreign national was killed as a result of shots fired in the area.”

item.title: Edmundo González, likely winner of Venezuela election, flees to Spain
item.dc:creator: María Luisa Paúl, Niha Masih, Samantha Schmidt
item.description: González fled days after the attorney general for Venezuela’s authoritarian president, Nicolás Maduro, filed a warrant for the arrest of the former diplomat.
